title: Emmerdale spoilers: Chas and Paddy's future revealed after baby birth
text:
Things are looking hopeful for some happy times ahead for Chas Dingle (Lucy Pargeter) and Paddy Kirk (Dominic Brunt) in Emmerdale as she gives birth to their baby – albeit in the chaotic conditions of the Woolpack toilets wth only Marlon (Mark Charnock) as a midwife!

The beloved couple, who went through hell after losing their daughter Grace, will welcome their new child to the world and after a typically dramatic birth, Lucy is certain that they will make a great family and there could be some settled times ahead.

They deserve it, after all!

The actress told us: ‘Paddy and Chas are brilliant, I think it’s great. Mandy has turned up, but she and Chas are getting on OK. From the very beginning Chas says “you look at him the wrong way and I’ll rip your head off and spit down your neck”. I love that line!

‘She’s set her stall out and when Mandy goes to the ante-natal class with Paddy, Chas doesn’t really get angry. Mandy’s always going to be there in the background but I don’t think Chas feels threatened by her at this point because they’re starting afresh and are just about to have this baby. Everything that happened last year is hopefully going to be made more palatable by the arrival of this new baby and hopefully can only make them stronger.

‘They haven’t really had much focus on the birth, apart from Paddy wanting to go to ante-natal classes. Chas was very much not wanting to only because of the questions she might be asked by the other mums, she feels like she’ll have to bring up what happened to Grace.

‘But Paddy and Chas have been absolutely fine, there hasn’t been much scare-mongering, just anticipation knowing that it’s going to happen.’

Long may the fine-ness continue!
